text: *Do 2 Net damage.n*End the run.

name: Sleeper
text: *End the run.

name: TKO 2.0
text: *End the run, and Runner forgoes his or her next action.
flavourText: There's nothing like a right hook to the left side of your brain to throw you a loop. - Digital Dana

name: Too Many Doors
text: *Secretly spend [0], ➊, or ➋
flavourText: Runner does the same. Then you and Runner reveal how much each of you spent. End the run unless you spent as many bits as Runner spent.

name: Triggerman
text: *Trash a program.n*End the run.
flavourText: Sweetheart, the emotional processing of two lonely ROM constructs isn't allocated a megabyte of RAM in this crazy world.

name: Tutor
text: *For the remainder of the run, all ice encountered has an additional subroutine, *End the run, after all other subroutines.

name: Vacuum Link
text: *Roll a die. If you roll a 1, 2, or 3, Runner resumes the run from that many pieces of rezzed ice back, or jacks out. If there are not that many pieces of ice, Runner returns to the first piece of ice.

name: Viral 15
text: *For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay ➊ to jack out, in addition to any other costs.n*For the remainder of the run, Runner trashes an installed program after passing each piece of rezzed ice, including Viral 15, unless Runner jacks out.

name: Virizz
text: *For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay an additional ➊ to break each ice subroutine.

name: Wall of Karte
text: *Do 2 Net damage.n*Do 2 Net damage.n*End the run.n*End the run.

name: Wall of Static
text: *End the run.

name: Zombie
text: *Do 1 brain damage.n*Do 1 brain damage.n*End the run.
flavourText: Every time a runner encounters a Zombie again, she's gotta be sayin' to herself, You used to be smarter than this!

name: All-Nighter
text: Make a run
flavourText: whether or not that run is successful, you may then make another run. Of course, you start to hallucinate if you string too many of these together.

name: Anonymous Tip
text: Derez a piece of black ice of your choice.
flavourText: Netwatch doesn't take hints about corporate infractions. If you really want them to apply some heat to a patch of black ice, get a Hellhound to follow your link back to their offices.

name: Arasaka Owns You
text: Do not play Arasaka Owns You as a normal action
flavourText: instead, play it when you would suffer enough damage to flatline you. Prevent all of that damage, trash Arasaka Owns You, remove any brain damage you have suffered, and then refresh your hand to its maximum size. Gain ➓ and remove all tags, at no cost. You forgo your next four actions, and you forfeit the next 3 agenda points you score.

name: Bodyweightu2122 Synthetic Blood
text: Draw five cards.

name: Core Command: Jettison Ice
text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Pay the rez cost of a piece of rezzed ice to trash it.

name: Custodial Position
text: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, access two additional cards from R&D.

name: Deal with Militech
text: Play only if you liberated any Research agendas this turn. Put a Militech counter on each of your icebreakers. A Militech counter gives the icebreaker it is on +1 strength.

name: Desperate Competitor
text: Play only if you liberated any Gray Ops agendas this turn. Score 1 agenda point.
flavourText: We appreciate that you've already promised this property to someone else, and we wouldn't expect you to compromise your honor without proper compensation.

name: Edited Shipping Manifests
text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, and the Corp has any bits when you would access HQ, do not access cards from HQ;instead, the Corp loses ➊ and gives you a tag, and you gain ➓.
flavourText: It's another delivery to that warehouse in Chiba for Smith. What does he do with all that product?

name: Executive Wiretraps
text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, access two additional cards from HQ.

name: Forged Activation Orders
text: Choose a piece of ice. The Corp either rezzes that piece of ice or trashes it.

name: Forgotten Backup Chip
text: Search your trash for a program and bring it into your hand.
flavourText: Solo teams are a crap shoot: sometimes they kill you;on the other hand, sometimes you find neat stuff while hiding in your flat.

name: Fortress Respecification
text: Play only if you made a successful run this turn. Rearrange the ice installed on the last fort on which you made a successful run. This does not expose any concealed ice.

name: Gideon's Pawnshop
text: Search your trash for a card and bring it into your hand.
flavourText: The runner stuff's cheap 'cause their next of kin don't know what it's worth any better than the shop owners do.

name: Hot Tip for WNS
text: Score 1 agenda point if you liberated any Black Ops agendas this turn.
flavourText: A plot to assassinate Elvis - bizarre but true, and we'll tell you all about it at eleven.

name: Hunt Club BBS
text: Expose up to three installed cards.
flavourText: The Hunt Club got it's name from the original programmers, who were self-described 'hunters,' corporate programmers who moonlighted as freelance counter-intrusion agents. - Rache Bartmoss

name: Ice and Data's Guide to the Net
text: Expose the outermost ice of each data fort.
flavourText: Meet the ice without hitting the skids. - Advert

name: If You Want It Done Right...
text: Look through the top five cards of your stack. Bring one of those cards into your hand, and arrange the rest in any order you choose.
flavourText: ... you gotta do it yourself.

name: Inside Job
text: Make a run. You automatically pass the first piece of ice you encounter during that run.
flavourText: Kartearation beats expiration, if you ask me. - Edger

name: Jack 'n' Joe
text: Draw three cards.
flavourText: There's too much blood in my caffeine system.

name: Kilroy Was Here
text: Make a run on R&D
flavourText: you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in R&D, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.Art is a form of catharsis.

name: Livewire's Contacts
text: Gain ➌.
flavourText: Let's get something clear, punk. Out there, you might be a big-shot chiphead with your uptown inputs, but down here you're just another skinny geek from the wrong side of the barricades. So sit down, buy me a Fizz, and let me do all the talking.

name: Lucidrineu2122 Booster Drug
text: Make a run, and gain ➒, which you may use only during that run. After that run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage
flavourText: this damage cannot be prevented. Then, return to the bank any of the ➒ not spent.

name: Mantis,Fixer-at-Large
text: Search your stack for a card, and bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.
flavourText: Yeah, I can get it for you, and if you want me to break a few fingers, I'll throw that in for free.

name: misc.for-sale
text: Trash any number of your installed cards. Gain ➌ for each card trashed in this way.
flavourText: Why throw it away when you can convince some half-brained weef to use it for creative suicide instead? - Rache Bartmoss

name: MIT West Tier
text: Shuffle your hand, trash, and stack together, and then draw five cards. When you play MIT West Tier, remove it from the game instead of trashing it.

name: Open-Ended® Mileage Program
text: Remove a tag, at no cost. You may pay ➊ when you play Open-Ended® Mileage Program to take it back into your hand instead of trashing it.

name: Organ Donor
text: Trash up to five cards from your hand. Gain ➋ for each card trashed in this way.
flavourText: I really need the scratch, and well, I do have two of them... .

name: Playful AI
text: Roll a die. On a 1, 2, or 3, gain that many bits, set aside that many dice to roll again, or choose some combination thereof. Repeat until you have rolled all the dice you set aside.
flavourText: Gaming is a mode of transferring property without producing any intermediate good. - Samuel Johnson

name: Priority Wreck
text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ;instead, pay any number of bits to force the Corp to lose that many bits.
flavourText: Your personal icon is unrecognized, Chairman;I cannot process this file. Please input authorization code within - Thank you. Filename 'Suckers!' overwrite of HQ datacore commencing as requested!

name: Private LDL Access
text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ
flavourText: instead, treat run as a successful run on R&D.

name: Romp through HQ
text: Make a run on HQ;you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in HQ, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
flavourText: I love the sound of screaming crystal. Sadly, I seem to be the one to hear it. - Rache Bartmoss

name: Score!
text: Gain ➒.
flavourText: If someone has consistently good luck, it ain't luck. - Spider Murphy

name: Security Code WORM Chip
text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Trash a piece of unrezzed ice.

name: Sneak Preview
text: Choose a program from your trash or search your stack for a program. Install that program, at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. At the end of the turn, take the program into your hand.

name: Social Engineering
text: Hide at least 2 from your pool in your hand
flavourText: the Corp then guesses how many bits you hid. If the Corp guesses correctly, lose that many bits. Otherwise, choose a data fort and a piece of ice on that fort. Then make a run on that fort, during which you automatically pass that piece of ice.

name: Stumble through Wilderspace
text: Make a run. You have +9 link for every trace attempt made during that run.
flavourText: So I guess what Wilderspace really is to me is the Net in the raw. - Edger, Wilderspace is Nothing

name: Synchronized Attack on HQ
text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. The Corp discards all cards. The Corp can retain cards by paying ➋ for each card not discarded.
flavourText: You just take out the guards. Let me worry about the doors and elevators.

name: Temple Microcode Outlet
text: Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp, and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.

name: Terrorist Reprisal
text: Play only if the Corp scored any Black Ops agendas during its last turn. The Corp discards five cards at random.
flavourText: So what did you tell Hiro when he asked if you'd accept half?nI said, 'No problem. Which half of your daughter do you want back?

name: Total Genetic Retrofit
text: Remove all tags, at no cost, and automatically avoid receiving your next tag.
flavourText: Twenty years ago it would have been just a new set of fingerprints.

name: Valu-Pak Software Bundle
text: Gain up to five consecutive actions, which you may use only to install programs, and gain ➊. If you do not spend the bit during these actions, return it to the bank afterwards.

name: Weather-to-Finance Pipe
text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ;instead, the Corp loses ➍.
flavourText: Fractal weather system modeling is best routed to Accounts Receivable if you wanted to caused a stir;a route to Market Research is likely to go unnoticed.

name: Afreet
text: Afreet can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it. All icebreakers installed in Afreet have their strength reduced by 1. If Afreet leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.

name: AI Boon
text: ➊: Break sentry subroutine.n➊: +1 strength.nAt the start of each run, roll a die to determine AI Boon's strength * for that run.
flavourText: Everything was going great until a Viral 18 wiped the instruction manual.

name: Baedeker's Net Map
text: [0]: Base link 1n➊: +1 linknUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
flavourText: I knew I should have taken the left region from Albuquerque!

name: Bakdooru2122
text: [0]: Base link 3n➋: +1 linknUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

name: Bartmoss Memorial Icebreaker
text: ➊: Break ice subroutine.n➊: +1 strengthnAfter passing each piece of ice, roll a die if you used Bartmoss Memorial Icebreaker to break any subroutines of that ice. On a 1, trash Memorial Icebreaker.

name: Black Dahlia
text: ➋: Break sentry subroutine.n➋: +1 strength
flavourText: She broke my heart - but at least she showed it to me first.

name: Blink
text: [0]: Roll a die. On a 4, 5, or 6, break ice subroutine
flavourText: otherwise, suffer that much Net damage. Use this ability only once on each subroutine during each encounter with a piece of ice.

name: Boardwalk
text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Boardwalk counter. At the start of each of your turns, every two Boardwalk counters require the Corp to show you, at random, a card stored in HQ. If the Corp does not have enough cards stored in HQ, the Corp shows you as many cards as it has.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Butcher Boy
text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Butcher Boy counter. Every two Butcher Boy counters gain you ➊ at the start of each of your turns.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Cascade
text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Cascade counter. Every two Cascade counters require the Corp to trash faceup one card stored in R&D, at the start of each of its turns.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Cloak
text: Put ➌ from the bank on Cloak when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
flavourText: Avoid a netfight if at all possible. You never know when fortune will turn. - Spider Murphy

name: Clown
text: All ice is encountered with its strength reduced by 1.

name: Cockroach
text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Cockroach counter. Two or more Cockroach counters cause all discards from HQ to become random.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Codecracker
text: [0]: Break code gate subroutine.n➊: +1 strength
flavourText: This product for use by holder of class-A locksmith certification. Propagation of this software and use without proper certification are felony offenses. (Yeah, right.)

name: Codeslinger
text: ➊: Break sentry subroutine.
flavourText: There ain't enough bits in this here register fer the both of us, pardner.

name: Cyfermasteru2122
text: ➋: Break code gate subroutine.n➊: +1 strength
flavourText: You can pick a lock;you can pick your friends. Now, thanks to Cyfermaster ...

name: Deep Thought
text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Thought counter. Three or more Thought counters allow you to look at the top card of R&D at the start of each of your turns.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Dogcatcher
text: ➊: Break pit bull, hellhound, bloodhound, or watchdog subroutine.n➊: +1 strength

name: Droppu2122
text: [0]: Break ice subroutine.n➊: +1 strengthnUsing Droppu2122 ends your run.

name: Dupr®
text: ➊: Break code gate subroutine.n➋: +1 strengthnPut a +1 strength counter on Dupr® after each run during which it was used to break a subroutine. All strength counters on Dupr® are lost if you use Dupr® on a fort other than the one you last used it on.

name: Dwarf
text: ➊: Break wall subroutine.n➊: +1 strength

name: Emergency Self-Construct
text: [T]: Prevent yourself from being flatlined, though you still lose all cards in your hand. Remove all brain damage. For the remainder of the game, you have only three actions per turn, instead of four;your hand size is reduced by 1;and all meat damage is automatically prevented.

name: Evil Twin
text: ➌: Break sentry subroutine.n➊: +1 strengthnPrevents up to 2 Net and/or brain damage total each turn.
flavourText: Haven't I seen you somewhere before?

name: Expert Schedule Analyzer
text: After you access cards from HQ, look at all cards stored in HQ.

name: Fait Accompli
text: Whenever you make a successful run on a subsidiary data fort, put a Fait counter in that fort. Every two Fait counters in a fort give +1 difficulty to all agendas installed inside that fort.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: False Echo
text: ➋: The Corp must rez as much ice as possible on a fort, beginning with the outermost ice and working in. Use this ability only after a successful run on that fort.

name: Flak
text: ➊: Break AP subroutine.n➊: +1 strength

name: Force Shield
text: Prevents up to 2 Net and/or brain damage total each turn.
flavourText: Never use 'em;don't need 'em. My brain's been smoked so much that my myelin's vulcanized. That's why my ears are always dirty. - Rache Bartmoss

name: Gremlins
text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Gremlin counter. Every two Gremlin counters decrease the Corp's hand size by 1.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Grubb
text: ➊: Break wall subroutine.n➋: +1 strength for the remainder of this run
flavourText: Is it really more nauseating than Worm?nYou've got to see it to believe it.

name: Hammer
text: ➊: Break wall subroutine.n➊: +1 strength.nWhenever you break a wall subroutine with Hammer, lose a total of ➋ from stealth cards.

name: I Spy
text: [T]: Put a Spy counter in a data fort. A Spy counter exposes all cards installed inside or on a fort containing it. The Corp may remove a Spy counter by taking an action to pay ➍. Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that fort.

name: Imp
text: Imp can have up to 2 MU of programs installed in it. All icebreakers installed in this way have their strength reduced by 1. If Imp leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.

name: Incubator
text: Whenever you make a successful run, give the Corp an Incubate counter. Each Incubate counter necessitates a die roll at the start of each of your turns
flavourText: on each 6, choose a Virus counter and exchange that counter for two counters of the same cardType.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Invisibility
text: Put ➊ from the bank on Invisibility when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

name: Jackhammer
text: [0]: Break wall subroutine.n➊: +1 strengthnWhenever you break a wall subroutine with Jackhammer, lose ➊, if you can, from a stealth card.

name: Japanese Water Torture
text: [0]: Break wall subroutine.n[X]: +X strength, and forgo your next X actions.

name: Joan of Arc
text: [T]: Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed.➊: Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed, and bring Joan of Arc into your hand.

name: Krash
text: ➋: Break ice subroutine.n➋: +1 strength

name: Loony Goon
text: ➊: Break sentry subroutine.n➊: +1 strength
flavourText: Of course you realize ... this means war.

name: Microtech AI Interface
text: Whenever you are about to access cards from R&D, you may first choose to cut any number of cards from the top of R&D to the bottom of R&D.

name: Mouse
text: A: Expose a card installed inside a data fort.
flavourText: If a man . . . make a better mousetrap than his neighbour, tho' he build his house in the woods, the world will make a beaten path to his door. - Ralph Waldo Emerson, quoted by Sarah S.B. Yule, Borrowings

name: Mystery Box
text: [0]: Show the top five cards of your stack to the Corp. If any of those cards are programs, trash Mystery Box and then install one of those programs, at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run and only once each run.

name: Netspace Inverter
text: Reverse a fort's ice cards so that the outermost piece of ice becomes the innermost piece of ice, and so forth. Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that data fort.

name: Newsgroup Filter
text: A: Gain ➋.
flavourText: You can find some useful stuff in the newsgroups if you can enlist an AI with the patience to wade through all the garbage.

name: Pattel's Virus
text: Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pattel counter on a piece of ice that had all its subroutines broken during that run. Each Pattel counter on a piece of ice reduces its strength by 1.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Pile Driver
text: ➌: Break up to four wall subroutines on a single piece of ice.n➊: +1 strength.nWhenever you use Pile Driver's break-walls subroutine, lose a total of ➌, from stealth cards.

name: Poltergeist
text: Put ➋ on Poltergeist when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing nodes. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

name: Pox
text: Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pox counter in the fort that was run. Every two Pox counters in a fort require the Corp to pay ➊, in addition to any other costs, to install a card inside or on that fort.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: R&D Protocol Files
text: A: Make a run on R&D, but instead of accessing cards, look at the top five cards of R&D.

name: Rabbit
text: Ice that attempts to trace you has its trace limit reduced by 1.

name: Raffles
text: ➊: Break code gate subroutine.n➋: +1 strength

name: Ramming Piston
text: ➋: Break wall subroutine.n➊: +1 strengthnWhenever you break a wall subroutine with Ramming Piston, lose a total of ➋ from stealth cards.

name: Raptor
text: ➋: Break sentry subroutine.n➊: +1 strength
flavourText: There's nothing quite like the screech of a Raptor echoing through the data halls as it sweeps in for a kill.

name: Reflector
text: [0]: Break stun, hellbolt, or knockout subroutine.
flavourText: This icebreaker is basically a last-ditch defense for when your Killers aren't getting the job done. It takes advantage of a design flaw in these sorts of ice to reflect their unique signals back at them, crashing their detection routines. - Digital Dana

name: Replicator
text: [0]: Break ice subroutine that traces.n➊: +1 strength

name: Scatter Shot
text: Put ➋ from the bank on Scatter Shot when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing upgrades. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

name: SeeYa
text: A, ➊: Expose an installed card.
flavourText: It's like a pair of magic specs. - Urza Bloodrunner

name: Self-Modifying Code
text: [T]: Search your stack for a program and install that program, if you can. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run.
flavourText: Now, if I could just do this with my DNA ... on the fly ... while eating. - Rache Bartmoss

name: Shaka
text: ➊: Break sentry subroutine.n➋: +1 strength

name: Shield
text: Prevents up to 2 Net damage each turn.
flavourText: Practice safe hacks: use Spartan® shields.

name: Shredder Uplink Protocol
text: A: Make a run on the Archives. If run is successful, do not access cards from the Archives;instead, treat run as a successful run on HQ.
flavourText: Gives a whole new meaning to the term 'trashing.'

name: Signpost
text: ➊: +2 link. Use this ability only once during each trace attempt, and only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent.

name: Skivviss
text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Skivviss counter. Each Skivviss counter requires the Corp to draw one extra card at the start of each of its turns.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters by forgoing its next three actions.

name: Smarteye
text: Once during each run, you may expose a piece of unrezzed ice as you approach it. You may then jack out before the Corp decides whether to rez the ice.

name: Snowball
text: Snowball has +1 strength for each subroutine it has broken during a run, until the end of that run.n➊: Break sentry subroutine.n➊: +1 strength

name: Speed Trap
text: [0]: Jack out before an upgrade or node takes effect. Use this ability only immediately after the Corp has rezzed that upgrade or node.
flavourText: This program is solely intended for emergency extrication from hazards presented during inadvertent trespass;it in no way is intended to encourage willful trespass or other illegal action. (Yeah, right.)

name: Startup Immolator
text: [T]: Pay the rez cost of a piece of ice to trash that piece of ice. Use this ability only if you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice.

name: Succubus
text: Succubus can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it. If Succubus leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.
flavourText: Hey, server...

name: Tinweasel
text: [0]: Break code gate subroutine.
flavourText: Why, yes, I do speak fluent Navajo.

name: Vewy Vewy Quiet
text: Put ➋ from the bank on Vewy Vewy Quiet when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
flavourText: You know what I like? Sneaking all the way in, and then barking all the way out! - Dog

name: Wild Card
text: [0]: Break sentry subroutine.n➌: +1 strength
flavourText: The survival of Al Capone's cronies into cyberspace has almost spiritual significance to many runners.

name: Wizard's Book
text: [0]: Break code gate subroutine.n➋: +1 strength
flavourText: Voluntas vincit omnia

name: Worm
text: [0]: Break wall subroutine.n➌: +1 strength
flavourText: It's hard to describe - but don't eat anything just before you watch it go into action.

name: Zetatech Software Installer
text: Put ➋ on Software Installer when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for installing programs. You may use these bits to install a program overwriting Software Installer itself. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

name: Arasaka Portable Prototype
text: Provides +3 MU. Installing Arasaka Portable Prototype costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. Put ➌ from the bank on Arasaka Portable Prototype when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: Armadillo Armored Road Home
text: Put ➋ from the bank on Armored Road Home when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.n[T]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.

name: Armored Fridge
text: Put seven Ablative counters on Armored Fridge when it is installed. When the last Ablative counter has been removed, trash Armored Fridge.nAblative counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
flavourText: I also once shut off the hot water line to my dishwasher and hid in there while it was running, but I'll never do that again - Rache Bartmoss

name: Artemis 2020
text: Provides +2 MU. Put ➋ from the bank on Artemis 2020 when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: Bodyweightu2122 Data Creche
text: Provides +1 MU. Once per turn, right after making a successful run, you can choose to make another run without taking an action to do so.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
flavourText: I better hijack another order for a five-gallon saline feed ... I might be in here a while.

name: Corolla Speed Chip
text: Put ➊ from the bank on Corolla Speed Chip when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using killers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

name: Dermatech Bodyplating
text: Prevents 1 meat damage each turn.
flavourText: Is that the best you can do, corp boy?

name: Drifter Mobile Environment
text: Put ➋ from the bank on Mobile Environment when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

name: Full Body Conversion
text: Prevents all meat damage. For each ➊ the Corp pays when meat damage is done, 1 point of meat damage is not prevented by this card.
flavourText: Don't use any big words when you talk to him: he's more hardware than wetware.

name: Green Knight Surge Buffers
text: Prevents 1 Net damage each turn.

name: HQ Interface
text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access an additional card from HQ.
flavourText: ... from Arasaka to Cuernavaca to Oaxaca - to me the gear does come.

name: Lifesaveru2122 Nanosurgeons
text: A: Draw two cards. Use this ability only if you were damaged during any of your last three actions.n[T]: Prevent 1 brain damage.

name: Microtech 'Trode Set
text: Pay ➊, in addition to the normal cost, to break each ice subroutine. Ignore all AP subroutines except those that trace, or that do Net damage. Prevents all but 1 Net damage from each AP subroutine you do not break.

name: Microtech Backup Drive
text: Whenever one or more installed programs are being sent to the trash at the same time, you may instead choose to put any or all of the programs on top of Microtech Backup Drive in any order you choose. If Backup Drive is removed from play, trash any cards on it.nA: Bring the top card on Backup Drive into your hand.

name: Militech MRAM Chip
text: Hand size +3
flavourText: I have a hard time remembering, when the chips are down.

name: MRAM Chip
text: Hand size +2
flavourText: Your brain's just like any other appliance, chummer. Works better if you plug it in. - Joey Two-Tails

name: Nasuko Cycle
text: ➌: Avoid receiving a tag.
flavourText: Puts the world into fast forward so you can skip scenes that ain't so pretty.

name: Pandora's Deck
text: Provides +2 MU. Put ➌ from the bank on Pandora's Deck when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: Parraline 5750
text: Provides +1 MU. Put ➊ from the bank on Parraline 5750 when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: PK-6089a
text: Provides +1 MU. Put ➌ from the bank on PK-6089a when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
flavourText: Hey, this sucker can keep your deadline from becoming a flatline. - Dog

name: R&D Interface
text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access an additional card from R&D.
flavourText: I have a friend in Oaxaca who sells to Ops in Cuernavaca who supply a tech at Arasaka . . .

name: Raven Microcyb Eagle
text: Provides +1 MU. Prevents 1 Net damage each turn. Put ➊ from the bank on Microcyb Eagle when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: Raven Microcyb Owl
text: Provides +1 MU. Put ➌ from the bank on Microcyb Owl when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: Record Reconstructor
text: A: Make a run on the Archives. If run is successful, do not access cards from the Archives
flavourText: instead, shuffle the face-up pile of the Archives and then put the top two cards from that pile on R&D.

name: Techtronicau2122 Utility Suit
text: Provides +1 MU. Prevents 1 meat damage each turn. Put ➎ on Techtronicau2122 Utility Suit when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: Tycho Mem Chip
text: Provides +3 MU.
flavourText: You know there was actually a time when three megabytes was considered a score to the black market.nWhat's a megabyte?

name: WuTech Mem Chip
text: Provides +1 MU.
flavourText: Here at WuTech, we take pride in our quest to make memory cheaper than water. - Erin Devlin, WuTech COO

name: Zetatech Mem Chip
text: Provides +2 MU.
flavourText: In 2019, sales dipped because of a rumor that the odd chip contained a miniature transmitter that sent the chip's data, encrypted, to the nearest Zetatech facility.

name: ZZ22 Speed Chip
text: Put ➋ from the bank on ZZ22 Speed Chip when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using killers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

name: Access through Alpha
text: ➊: Base link 9nUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
flavourText: Wilderspace is made up of those areas of the Net that have not already been catalogued into one region or another. - Spider Murphy

name: Access to Arasaka
text: ➋: Base link 4n➋: +1 linknUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

name: Access to Kiribati
text: ➊: Base link 1n➊: +1 linknUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
flavourText: Third-World security and First-World bureaucracy - together at last.

name: Aujourd'Oui
text: A: Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any program cards among them into your hand. Pay ➊ for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle your stack.

name: Back Door to Hilliard
text: [0]: Base link 2n➌: +1 linknUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
flavourText: Hilliard Registrar query confirmed for Ice UNIT CERBERUS BD62663-R. Sorry, Mr. Cerberus, that class is full, though if you obtain authorization from your proctor, you may petition for entrance.

name: Back Door to Orbital Air
text: ➊: Base link 2n➋: +1 linknUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
flavourText: If you think the airlines are good at losing luggage, you should see what they can do with a trace attempt.

name: Broker
text: Each of your turns, you may take only one action to use Broker.nA: Put ➌ from the bank on Broker.nA: Take all the bits from Broker.

name: Code Viral Cache
text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. If the Corp forgoes actions to lose Virus counters, two counters of your choice are not removed. The Corp may trash Viral Cache by taking an action to pay ➎.

name: Corporate Ally
text: Installing Corporate Ally costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. The difficulty of all agendas is +1.nOnly one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

name: Crash Everett,Inventive Fixer
text: Whenever you draw one or more cards from your stack, draw an extra card
flavourText: then choose one of the cards drawn and either trash it or return it to the top of your stack.nOnly one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

name: Danshi's Second ID
text: A, [T]: Remove up to three tags, at no cost.
flavourText: I'll take the complete package: apartment, ID number, passports, credit account, fake diplomas, fingerprints, retinas ...

name: Databroker
text: A, [T], 1 agenda point: Gain ➓.
flavourText: Information does not want to be free;it wants to be liberated and expensive.

name: Diplomatic Immunity
text: Prevents all meat damage. The Corp may pay 1 agenda point to cancel this effect until end of turn. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

name: Fall Guy
text: [T]: Avoid receiving a tag.
flavourText: What I like best about you, Neal, is that you trust me.

name: Field Reporter of Ice and Data
text: At the end of each of your turns, gain ➊ for each piece of ice the Corp rezzed during that turn.

name: Floating Runner BBS
text: Gain ➊ at the start of each of your turns.

name: Hell's Run
text: Put ➊ from the bank on Hell's Run when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for increasing your link. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

name: Junkyard BBS
text: A, ➊: Bring the top card from your trash into your hand.
flavourText: You wouldn't believe the stuff some people throw away!

name: Karl de Veres,Corporate Stooge
text: Gain ➊ each time you make a successful run.nOnly one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

name: Leland,Corporate Bodyguard
text: ➊: Prevent 1 meat damage.n[T]: Avoid receiving a tag.
flavourText: Friends help you move. Real friends help you move bodies.

name: Loan from Chiba
text: Gain [12] when Loan from Chiba is installed. At the start of each of your turns, lose ➊. If Loan from Chiba leaves play, pay ➓ or lose the game. You may trash Loan from Chiba at the end of any of your turns.
flavourText: I hear their collection agents have organ preserva-paks. And dull scalpels.

name: N.E.T.O.
text: A: Look at the top four cards of your stack. You may bring any prep or resource cards among them into your hand. Pay ➊ for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack.

name: Nomad Allies
text: A, ➊: Remove a tag, at no cost.n[T]: Avoid receiving a tag.
flavourText: So, what are we calling you this month?

name: Preying Mantis
text: Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action. If you do, suffer 1 brain damage at the end of the turn. This damage cannot be prevented.
flavourText: First hit's free!

name: Quest for Cattekin
text: At the start of each of your turns, roll a die. On a 6, trash Quest for Cattekin, and you gain an action on each of your turns for the remainder of the game. On a 1, suffer 1 brain damage. On a 2, suffer 1 Net damage. Damage from Quest for Cattekin cannot be prevented.

name: Restrictive Net Zoning
text: Choose a data fort when Restrictive Net Zoning is installed. The Corp must pay ➋, in addition to the normal cost, to install ice on that fort.
flavourText: Corporation wishing to conduct business here should consider the cost of getting intrusion countermeasures to blend with the high-rez scenery of an AW-1 (Alice in Wonderland) Zone.

name: Rigged Investments
text: Put [12] from the bank on Rigged Investments when it is installed. At the start of each of your turns, take ➊ from Rigged Investments. When all the bits have been removed, trash Rigged Investments.

name: Ronin Around
text: A: Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any hardware cards among them into your hand. Pay ➊ for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack.nA, ➋: Expose any card.

name: Short-Term Contract
text: Put [12] from the bank on Short-Term Contract when it is installed. When all the bits have been removed, trash Short-Term Contract.nA: Take ➋ from Short-Term Contract.
flavourText: Contrary to popular opinion, we are productive members of society. We just moonlight as data raiders. - Spider Murphy

name: Silicon Saloon Franchise
text: A: Gain ➊ and draw one card.
flavourText: WANTED: Enterprising civilian with capital to invest in entertainment franchise. Management experience not required. Corporations, nomads, and AIs need not apply.

name: Smith's Pawnshop
text: At the start of each of your turns, you may trash one of your other installed cards to gain ➋.nOnly one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all but one.

name: Submarine Uplink
text: [0]: Base link 4n➊: +1 link.nYou may use Submarine Uplink only during a run. Using Submarine Uplink forces you to jack out after the current encounter ends.nUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

name: Technician Lover
text: A: Look at the top card of R&D.
flavourText: Enough about me. How's work?

name: The Shell Traders
text: A: Choose a program or hardware card from your hand. Set that card aside, and put a number of Shell counters on it equal to its installation cost. When the last Shell counter on that card has been removed, install that card, at no cost. Remove one Shell counter from one card at the start of each of your turns.n➊: Remove one Shell counter from a card.

name: The Short Circuit
text: A, ➊: Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp, and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.

name: The Springboard
text: ➊: +1 link. Use this ability only once during each trace attempt, and only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent.
flavourText: Blow 600 eb or risk blowing your cortex - it's your choice. - Springboard advertisement

name: Top Runner's Conference
text: Gain ➋ at the start of each of your turns. Trash Top Runners' Conference when you make a run.
flavourText: I have discovered a truly elegant codebreaking routine. Unfortunately, this chip is not large enough to contain it.

name: Trauma Teamu2122
text: Put two Trauma counters on Trauma Teamu2122 when it is installed. Trauma counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.nA: Put one Trauma counter on Trauma Teamu2122.

name: Umbrella Policy
text: [T]: Prevent an installed program or hardware card from being trashed.
flavourText: I cashed in their warranty when my utility was trashed by their own ice! - Spider Murphy

name: Wilson,Weeflerunner Apprentice
text: Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action, which you may use only to make a run. You cannot spend more than ➌ during that run to pay for using icebreakers or increasing your link. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn.n[T]: Avoid receiving a tag.n[T]: Prevent any amount of meat damage.

name: Corporate Guard Temps
text: Pay two times [X] when you play Corporate Guard® Temps, to gain an action during each of your next X turns. Forfeit the next [X] you gain.

name: Credit Consolidation
text: Gain [15].
flavourText: Here's the balance shett on our hidden accounts. I suggest we have Finance sonsolidate the newly decriminalized activities with ligitimate loan

name: Data Sifters
text: Play only if Runner trashed any nodes during his or her last turn.nGive Runner a tag.
flavourText: The runner tried to crash the entire file structure, but the black-box routines on the login records held.

name: Emergency Rig
text: Rez a piece of ice, at no cost. Put X Kludge counters on that piece of ice
flavourText: X cannot be 0. At the start of each of your turns, remove a Kludge counter. Trash that piece of ice when the last Kludge counter is removed from it.

name: Manhunt
text: Play only if Runner attempted a run during his or her last turn.nTrace6 - If trace is successful, give Runner one tag for each point by which your trace exceeded his or her link.
flavourText: I want his friends dead! I want his family dead! I want his deck dead!

name: Rent-to-Own Contract
text: Rez a piece of ice, at no cost. Put on that ice a number of Term counters equal to its rez cost. At the start of each of your turns, if you have at least ➋, lose ➋ and remove one of these Term counters
flavourText: otherwise, put a Term counter on that piece of ice.

name: Schlaghund Pointers
text: Play only if Runner has attempted a run this game.nTrace3 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag. Pay ➊, in addition to the normal cost, for each point of trace above 0.
flavourText: The mark lives in a city that lets wild dogs run around as a way of curbing the homeless presence, and these puppies will blend right in.

name: Underworld Mole
text: Play only if Runner installed any resources during his or her last turn.nTrace4 - If trace is successful, trash a resource Runner installed during his or her last turn and give Runner a tag.
flavourText: Everybody knows somebody who knows a little too much about anybody

name: Herman Revista
text: [0]: Rearrange the ice installed on this fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run on this data fort.
flavourText: So you say that only a fool would install the Watchdog and the Jack Attack inside the black ice? Why don't you rin it anyway, just for kics.

name: Lesley Major
text: Install Lesley Major only in a subsidiary data fort.n➎: Add two advancement counters, at no cost, to a card installed in this data fort. Use this ability only when Runner passes the last piece of ice on this fort, and only once per run.

name: Lisa Blight
text: ➊, Discard a card at random: Repeat one subroutine on a piece of ice on this fort, until the end of the run. Treat the copy of the subroutine as if it appeared immediately after the original subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.

name: Marcel DeSoleil
text: ➋, Trash the top two cards stored in R&D: Repeat one subroutine on a piece of ice on this fort, until the end of the run. Treat the copy of the subroutine as if it appeared immediately after the original subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.

name: Networked Center
text: The difficulty of Gray Ops agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1.nRez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

name: Obfuscated Fortress
text: At the start of a run on this fort, Runner must announce the number of bits he or she will spend during the run. Runner cannot spend more than this during that run. If Runner does not spend that many bits during that run, the Runner loses the remainder once the run is complete. You may rez Obfuscated Fortress at the start of a run on this fort.

name: Panic Button
text: Install Panic Button only in HQ.n➊: Draw a card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
flavourText: As a last resort, I'm trying something I learned from Marketing: bombard him with sexy options and chances are he'll choose something he doesn't need.

name: Pavit Bharat
text: Install Pavit only in a subsidiary data fort. When you rez Pavit Bharat, uninstall all cards installed in this fort and store them in HQ. Install an equal number of cards from HQ in this fort. Rez Pavit Bharat only when Runner has passed the last piece of ice on this fort.
flavourText: Pavit means pious-but hey, it's not like any parents predict their kid will grow up to be a ruthless security agent.

name: Rasmin Bridger
text: After Runner passes each piece of ice on this fort, Runner must pay ➊ or end the run.
flavourText: Fifty for the Shotgun Wire, twenty to get past the Filter-even the Hellhound wanted a cool three hundred! That place is worse than a third-world bureaucracy! We should seriously rethink their merger proposal.-Erin Devlin, WuTech COO

name: Raymond Ellison
text: Install Raymond Ellison only in a subsidiary data fort.n[T]: Remove any number of advancement counters from cards installed in this data fort. Gain ➌ for each advancement counter removed. Use this ability only during a run. At the end of the run, return to the bank any of the bits gained that you did not spend.

name: Research Bunker
text: The difficulty of research agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1.nRez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

name: Simon Francisco
text: Install Simon Francisco only in R&D or HQ.nDuring a run in which Simon Francisco is accessed, Runner accesses one less card stored in this fort.
flavourText: No, no, we don't have enforcers here at Futokora. You must've met one of our customer service reps.

name: Weapons Depot
text: The difficulty of Black Ops agendas installed in this fort is reduced by 1.nRez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each fort. Trash older ones.

name: Bel-Digmo Antibody
text: Shuffle Bel-Digmo Antibody into R&D when it is rezzed. When Runner accesses Bel-Digmo Antibody from R&D, do 1 Net damage, and Runner must show it to you.

name: Cybertech Think Tank
text: You may advance Cybertech Think Tank before and after you rez it.nCybertech Think Tank advancement counter: Increase by 1 the meat damage dealt by another source.

name: Department of Misinformation
text: You may rez Department of Misinformation when Runner attempts to expose a card.n➊: Prevent a card from being exposed.
flavourText: I'm sorry, sir, the department you requested does not exist. Could I get your name and number and have them call you back?

name: Doppelganger Antibody
text: When Runner accesses Doppelganger Antibody, you may pay ➋ to give Runner a Doppelganger counter, even if Doppelganger is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Doppelganger from the Archives. Each Doppelganger counter causes Runner to lose ➊ at the start of each of his or her turns. Runner may take an action to pay ➍ to remove a Doppelganger counter. If Doppelganger is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

name: Executive Boot Camp
text: Discard a card at random: Gain ➋. Use this ability only during a run. At the end of the run, return to the bank any of the ➋ you did not spend.

name: Government Contract
text: You may advance Government Contract before and after you rez it.nGovernment Contract advancement counter: Gain ➌. Use these bits only to pay for installing or rezzing cards. When the turn ends, return to the bank any of the ➌ you did not spend.

name: LDL Traffic Analyzers
text: You may advance LDL Traffic Analyzers before and after you rez it.nYou may rez LDL Traffic Analyzers during a trace attempt.nLDL Traffic Analyzers advancement counter: Gain ➎. Use this ability only during a trace attempt. When the trace attempt ends, return to the bank any of the ➎ you did not spend.

name: Pattel Antibody
text: When Runner accesses Pattel Antibody, you may pay ➌ to put a Pattel counter on all installed icebreakers, even if Pattel Antibody is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Pattel Antibody from the Archives. Each Pattel counter on an icebreaker reduces its strength by 1. If Pattel Antibody is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

name: Siren
text: Rez Siren when you install it. Install Siren only if you can pay to rez it.n➊: If possible, Runner must make a run on the fort Siren is installed in, instead of on the fort he or she was originally going to make a run on. Use this ability only at the start of a run.
flavourText: They'll come. Just leak one word:'oops®-Magnificent Curtis

name: Stereogramm Antibody
text: When Runner accesses Stereogram Antibody from the Archives, do 1 Net damage and shuffle Stereogram Antibody into R&D
flavourText: Don't focus on it! Just let your deck's interface routines save you the headache...and the nosebleed from the feedback.

name: Syd Meyer Superstores
text: A: Trash a rezzed piece of ice. Gain ➍.
flavourText: Let me get this straight: you ran the databanks of Syd Meyer Superstores with a 'breaker you bought at Syd's? Congrats, you just participated in their standard product-test program.

name: AI Board Member
text: You may gain an action during each of your turns. At the start of each of your turns, roll a die to see what the action will be for that turn, and then decide whether to take it. On a 1, you may use the action only to install a card;on a 2 or 3, only to gain ➊;on a 4, 5, or 6, only to draw a card.

name: Charity Takeover
text: Gain 9 and 1 Bad Publicity point.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
flavourText: We don't call them 'Black Ops' because they're immoral;we call them that because they put us in the black.

name: Corporate Headhunters
text: Whenever Corporate Headhunters successfully does damage, Runner's hand size is reduced by 1.nA: Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
flavourText: He wasn't much of a security risk, but we flatlined him anyway.

name: Fetal AI
text: When Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 Net damage, even if it is not installed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses Fetal AI from the Archives. If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you. Runner must pay 2 to steal Fetal AI, in addition to any other costs.

name: Marked Accounts
text: When Runner accesses Marked Accounts, give Runner a tag, even if it is not installed. If Marked Accounts is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.
flavourText: First Eurobank called, reporting a failed credit transfer from one of our marked funds. They're giving us the perp's address.nGood. So which fund was broken into?nHeh. Get this: 'Counterintrusion Disbursements.'

name: Please Don't Choke Anyone
text: For each 1 damage you successfully do, you may choose instead to prevent that damage and put a PDCAcounter on Please Don 't Choke Anyone.nPDCA counter: Gain an action. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn.
flavourText: First let's consider the problem not as a series of independent actions, Bob, but as a series of...Oh lord, just kill him.

name: Project Venice
text: For every three advancement counters over Project Venice 's difficulty that are on Project Venice when you score it, gain an action during each of your turns.
flavourText: Attention all substations: Project Venice has crashed again due to server difficulties. Please observe safety precautions while unplugging any programmers or corprunners.

name: Project Zurich
text: For every two advancement counters over Project Zurich 's difficulty that are on Project Zurich when you score it, gain 1 at the start of each of your turns.
flavourText: Woth only minor deviation from standard accounting practices, we can improve our bottom line significantly.

name: Viral Breeding Ground
text: When you score Breeding Ground, trash all cards installed in or on the fort Breeding Ground was installed in. When Runner accesses Breeding Ground, choose up to two programs for each advancement counter on Breeding Ground
flavourText: Runner brings those programs into his or her hand.

name: World Domination
text: Score an additional 4 agenda points when you score World Domination.

name: Brain Wash
text: *Do 1 brain damage.
flavourText: I can see clearly now my brain is gone.

name: Bug Zapper
text: *Do 2 Net damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Bug Zapper.n*End the run.
flavourText: Try it for a month, and if it doesn't flatline anyone, send it back at our expense!

name: Caryatid
text: *End the run.nWhen you rez Caryatid, you may pay ➊, above the rez cost, to make it a code gate instead of a wall.
flavourText: All the form and twice the function of our previous model-the Galatea.

name: Chihuahua
text: *Trace1 - If trace is successful, do 1 Net damage.nGain ➋ when you rez Chihuahua.
flavourText: Almost to cute to kick. Almost

name: Colonel Failure
text: *Trash a program.n*Trash a program.n*Trash a program.n*End the run.n*End the run.
flavourText: War is the continuation of business by other means.

name: Coyote
text: *For the remainder of the run, all further ice is encountered at +1 strength, unless Runner pays ➋ while passing Coyote.nGain ➌ when you rez Coyote.

name: Credit Blocks
text: *End the run.nWhen you rez Credit Blocks, you may pay ➊, above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
flavourText: At the right frequency, the bull-and-bear puls of a seasoned corp's finacial curve will paralyze a sane mind.

name: Datacomb
text: *End the run.nIf Runner passes Datacomb, pay ➊, or uninstall it and store it in HQ
flavourText: Getting at the honey sometimes means taking a sting or two.

name: Death Yo-Yo
text: *Do 1 brain damage.n*End the run.nIf Runner passes Death Yo-Yo, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain ➊.
flavourText: This is a trick I call 'walkin' the dog.'

name: Digiconda
text: *Do 2 Net damage.n*End the run.nPay [X], above the rez cost, when you rez Digiconda. X is Digiconda 's strength, and X cannotbe greater than 6.
flavourText: See that lump? It's still digesting the data from the last weeflerunner icon it caught.

name: Dog Pile
text: *Do 1 Net damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Dog Pile.n*End the run.nDog Pile has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside it.

name: Food Fight
text: Food Fight has one *End the run subroutine for every ➋ you pay, above the rez cost, when you rez it.
flavourText: Frack, Hans, end the run! It's the Food Fight!

name: Galatea
text: *End the run.nWhen you rez Galatea, you may pay ➊, above the rez cost, to make it a code gate instead of a wall.
flavourText: She's stonewalling.

name: Gatekeeper
text: Gatekeeper has one *End the run subroutine for every ➋ you pay, above the rez cost, when you rez it.
flavourText: The icon alone does most of the work for us.

name: Homing Missile
text: *Tracex - If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot make another run until Runner takes an action to pay ➋.nPay [X], above the rez cost, when you rez Homing Missile. X is Homing Missile 's strength and trace limit, and X cannot be greater than 8.

name: Hunting Pack
text: For each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Hunting Pack, Hunting Pack has one subroutine as follows: *Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

name: Iceberg
text: *Do 1 Net damage.n*➋: Iceberg has one *End the run subroutine for the present encounter. Use this ability only when Runner encounters Iceberg.

name: Lesser Arcana
text: *End the run.nWhen you rez Lesser Arcana, you may pay 1, above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
flavourText: You'd think a hammer would blow through a wall of cards without even slowing down.nYou're taking the Net too literally again, kit.

name: Marionette
text: *Trash a program.n*End the run.nIf Runner passes Marionette, pay ➊, or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
flavourText: The Marionette's not such a big deal;it's who's pulling the strings.

name: Mastermind
text: n*Do 1 brain damage for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside Mastermind.n*End the run.nMastermind has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of ice installed outside it.

name: Minotaur
text: For each rezzed code gate or wall installed outside Minotaur, Minotaur has one *End the run subroutine.

name: Misleading Access Menus
text: *End the run unless Runner pays ➊.nGain ➌ when you rez Misleading Access Menus.
flavourText: You wouldn't believe how many suckers try to access 'Tools/Certain Death.'

name: Mobile Barricade
text: *Do 1 Net damage.n*End the run.n➊: Move Mobile Barricade and insert it in a different position on this data fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run on this data fort. You may use this ability even if Mobile Barricade is unrezzed, in which case, you reveal it.

name: Riddler
text: ➋: Riddler has one *End the run subroutine for the present encounter. Use this ability only when Runner encounters Riddler.
flavourText: Why is a raven like a write-protect?

name: Roadblock
text: *End the run.nWhen Runner encounters Roadblock, roll a die. On a 6, derez Roadblock, and Runner automatically passes it;otherwise, add the result to Roadblock's strength for that encounter.
flavourText: Do you have any stolen data to declare?

name: Sandstorm
text: Sandstorm has one *End the run subroutine for every ➋ you pay, above the rez cost, when you rez it.
flavourText: Like a snow crash, only much grittier.

name: Scaffolding
text: *End the run.nIf Runner passes Scaffolding, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain ➊.
flavourText: Usually, it's not the scaffolding that's the problem but whatever it is they're repairing on the other side.

name: Snowbank
text: *End the run unless Runner pays ➊.nGain ➌ when you rez Snowbank.
flavourText: Sure you can jump right through, but let me tell you a story about a kid on my street who jumped off his fire escape into a snowbank....

name: Sphinx 2006
text: *End the run.nWhen you rez Sphinx 2006, you may pay ➍, above the rez cost, to make it a sentry instead of a code gate.
flavourText: What runs on four megs in the morning, two megs in the afternoon, and three megs in the evening?

name: Sumo 2008
text: *End the run.nWhen you rez Sumo 2008, you may pay ➊, above the rez cost, to make it a wall instead of a sentry.
flavourText: I see the kanji characters on his belt translate to 'wide load.'nPlus, if you lokk real close, you can see I coded a smiley face in his navel.

name: Toughoniumu2122 Wall
text: End the run.n*End the run.n*End the run.n*End the run.

name: Tumblers
text: *End the run.nIf Runner passes Tumblers, you may choose to uninstall it, store it in HQ, and gain ➊.
flavourText: They're not pistons. They just put the flattened icon in as a sick joke.

name: Twisty Passages
text: *End the run.nIf Runner passes Twisty Passages, pay ➊, or uninstall it and store it in HQ.
flavourText: It's got routines that specifically target Smarteye;the eyeball becomes a little eight ball that says, You see a little file here. Do you want to go (n)orth or (s)outh?

name: Walking Wall
text: *End the run.n➊: Move Walking Wall and insert it in a different position on this data fort. Use this ability only at the start of a run on this data fort. You may use this ability even if Walking Wall is unrezzed, in which case, you reveal it.

name: Washed-Up Solo Construct
text: *Trash a program unless Runner pays ➊.nGain ➌ when you rez Washed-Up Solo Construct.
flavourText: Before they made my construct they told me, 'You're getting too slow for street work, but we can transfer you into software security.' How was I to know?

name: All-Hands
text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, access three additional cards from HQ. You cannot use noisy icebreakers during the run.
flavourText: Now who called this meeting?

name: Blackmail
text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ
flavourText: instead, score 1 agenda point.

name: Cruising for Netwatch
text: Gain ➊ and draw two cards.
flavourText: Back home on the bayou, before it dried up, the good ole boys would ambush federal patrolmen just to try out their new cyberware. Now we bushwhack stray Netwatch goons just to try out our new programs. Some things just don't go out of style.-Digital Dana

name: Decoy Signal
text: Make a run. Whenever you approach an unrezzed piece of ice during that run, expose it. You may jack out before the Corp decides whether to rez the ice.
flavourText: Neat piece of code. Reminds me of a weef i used to know.-Max Forward

name: Demolition Run
text: Make a run. If run is successful, do not access cards;  instead, trash all rezzed ice on the fort on which you just made a run, and the Corp gives you three tags.
flavourText: Sure it was woth it. Now hurry up and get packed;they'll be here in a minute.

name: Disgruntled Ice Technician
text: Make a run. After passing a piece of ice during this run, you may derez that ice and end your run if you broke all the subroutines of that ice.
flavourText: Even if they catch me doing this, they'll have me improving their ice to the bitter end. Of course, I'd rather that end not to be strapped to a couch in Sk®lderviken.

name: Drone for a Day
text: Gain ➒ and the Corp gives you a tag.
flavourText: Sure you won't stay? No one else here understands our business half as well as you do.

name: Faked Hit
text: Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point. Take 2 brain damage. This damage cannot be prevented.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
flavourText: I won't need much air with the coma drug, but I could still get hypoxia if you don't get me out of the bag in time.

name: Frame-Up
text: Play only if you made a successful run on both HQ and R&D this turn. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point. Give the Corp 1 additional Bad Publicity point if you liberated or trashed any Black Ops cards during those runs.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
flavourText: But we weren't going to do that until next week!

name: Hijack
text: Install a program or a piece of hardware. Gain ➌, which you may use only to pay for its installation cost. Return to the bank any of the ➌ you did not spend.

name: Ice and Data Special Report
text: Expose up to five cards installed in or on a single data fort.
flavourText: Max Forward is a freelance writer and nrindex, and has recently made available to the runner community the icebreaker technology he describes.-contributor's bio

name: Identity Donor
text: Do not play Identity Donor as an action
flavourText: instead, play it during the Corp 's turn when you would suffer meat damage. Prevent that meat damage and give the Corp 2 Bad Publicity points.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

name: Live News Feed
text: Make a run. If run is successful, the Corp gives you two tags, and you give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point for each black ice you encountered during the run, 1 for each Black Ops card the Corp rezzed during the run, and 1 for each Black Ops agenda you liberated during the run.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

name: On the Fast Track
text: Gain ➑ if you trashed an advertisement card this turn, or gain ➏ if you trashed a transactions card this turn.
flavourText: He was a nobody until I doctored their auditions database. I rigged that campaign to fail, of course, but it lasted long enough for him to get paid.

name: Pirate Broadcast
text: Make a run on each data fort. Score 1 agenda point if all the runs are successful. Forgo your next action if any of the runs are not successful.
flavourText: It's scary how ineffective the law is these days. It used to be that we could turn corporate dirt over to the Feds, and let the do the rest of the network. Nowadays we have to do everything ourselves.-Digital Dana

name: Poisoned Water Supply
text: Play only if you have at least two connections in play. Trash two connections. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

name: Prearranged Drop
text: The next time you access an agenda this turn, gain ➏.
flavourText: Maybe you and I could-nKeep it simple, stupid.

name: Promises,Promises
text: The next time you access an agenda this turn, score 1 additional agenda point.
flavourText: Ishiguro apologizes for doubting your ability to find data incriminating our competitor. He humbly offers this unworthy gift for uncovering highly sensitive plans for world domination.

name: Reconnaissance
text: Make a run. Whenever the Corp rezzes a card during that run, gain ➊.
flavourText: We'll put a tap on your line and transfer credit after each piece of ice you hit. Oh, and don't worry, even if surge ice fries you, our buffers will ensure the data reachus us safely.

name: Remote Detonator
text: Play only if you made a successful run on a data fort this turn. Trash all rezzed ice on that fort, and the Corp gives you three tags.
flavourText: It takes a long time-hundreds of milliseconds!-to feed all the ice specs to the planted viruses, so you'd better riding a Nasuko cycle through the fourth dimension, because the Corp has your number!

name: Rush Hour
text: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, access three additional cards from R&D. You cannot use noisy icebreakers during the run.
flavourText: Sure there are more signals to hide in, but there's also a greater chance of someone being around who'll jump you of you get noticed.

name: Senatorial Field Trip
text: Play only if the Corp rezzed a piece of Black Ice this turn. The Corp either derezzes that piece of ice or receives 2 Bad Publicity points.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

name: Stakeout
text: Gain ➋ and draw one card.
flavourText: This is reconnaissance, not voyeurism, Wilson.

name: Subliminal Corruption
text: Make a run. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point for each advertisement you trash during the run.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.
flavourText: SFX'! It says 'SFX'!

name: Test Spin
text: Search your stack for a program, and install it, at no cost. Shuffle your stack. If you install a program in this way, make a run. After the run, shuffle the program into your stack, unless it is no longer in play, in which case, lose ➍ plus its installation cost. If this is more than the number of bits in your pool, suffer the difference in meat damage.
flavourText: And when you bring it back, we'll deactivate the code bomb for free.

name: The Personal Touch
text: Put a +1 strength counter on an icebreaker.
flavourText: I think that if I'd been spending my time and money on any other 'breaker thank Dhalia, my girlfriend would have understood.

name: Weefle Initiation
text: Make a run. Prevent up to 7 damage during that run.
flavourText: Lost another one.nSo?

name: Armageddon
text: After each successful run on R&D, you may choose to give the Corp a Doom counter instead of accessing cards from R&D. Each Doom counter forces the Corp to roll a die whenever it installs a card. On a 6, the card is trashed after it is installed, and the Corp removes a Doom counter.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

name: Big Frackin' Gun
text: ➏: Break up to five sentry subroutines on a single piece of ice.n➊: +1 strength
flavourText: Does that have to be your solution to everything?nWell...yes, now stand back.

name: Black Widow
text: ➊: Break sentry subroutine.n➋: +1 strengthnChoose an installed piece of ice when you install Black Widow. Black Widow gets +5 strength during each encounter with that piece of ice.
flavourText: When she pours on the charm, piece of ice falls hard.

name: Boring Bit
text: ➋: Break wall subroutine.n➊: +1 strength
flavourText: An effective drill, but pretty dull.

name: Bulldozer
text: ➊: Break wall subroutine.n➋: +1 strengthnIf Bulldozer breaks all the subroutines of a wall, and the next piece of ice encountered during this run is a sentry, break one of the subroutines of that sentry, at no cost.nWhenever you break a wall subroutine with Bulldozer, lose a total of ➋ from stealth cards.

name: Corrosion
text: [0]: Break wall subroutine.n➊: +1 strength
flavourText: Sometimes all it takes is a little drip to make a big hole.

name: Crumble
text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Crumble counter. Two or more Crumble counters allow you trash, at no cost, any cards accessed from HQ, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

name: Disintegrator
text: ➋: Derez a piece of ice and end your run. Use this ability only when you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice and have successfully passed it.
flavourText: Every time Dhalia laid out a sentry, I'd hand her Disintegrator and say, 'You do the honors.' But that got old in a hurry.

name: Enterprise Inc. Shields
text: ➊: Prevent up to 2 Net damage.n➊: Prevent 1 brain damage.
flavourText: I know I always feel more enterprising when my shields are up.-Advert

name: Forward's Legacy
text: [0]: Break sentry subroutine.nAt the start of each run, roll a die and add the result to Legacy 's strength for that run.
flavourText: Forward was a good runner, but wandered a little too close to the edge....

name: Fubar
text: ➊: Break a subroutine of the cardType chosen for Fubar.n➋: +1 strengthn[0]: Choose whether Fubar breaks code gates, sentries, or walls. Use this ability only once.nWhenever you break an ice subroutine with Fubar, lose ➊ from a stealth card.

name: Garbage In
text: After each successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Garbage counter. Two or more Garbage counters allow you to trash, at no cost, any cards accessed from R&D, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed. The Corp loses two Garbage counters after any run during which this ability is used.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

name: Highlighter
text: After each successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Highlighter counter. Each Highlighter counter after the first allows you to access an additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

name: Lockjaw
text: [T]: Give one of your icebreakers +2 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during an encounter with a piece of ice.
flavourText: Yeah, but its a little bit too loyal;it just doesn't know when to get out of the way.

name: Morphing Tool
text: ➋: Break a subroutine of the cardType last chosen for Morphing Tool.n➊: +1 strengthn➊, A: Choose whether Morphing Tool breaks code gates, sentries, or walls.nWhen you install Morphing Tool, choose whether it breaks code gates, sentries, or walls.

name: Redecorator
text: ➊: Break up to two sentry subroutines on a single piece of ice.n➌: +1 strength
flavourText: I've wanted to name a Killer this ever since my SATs went out claiming to schools that I planned to become an interior decorator.

name: Scaldan
text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Scaldan counter. Each Scaldan counter forces the Corp to roll a die at the start of each of its turns. On a 5 or a 6, the Corp gains 1 Bad Publicity point.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

name: Skeleton Passkeys
text: [0]: Break code gate subroutine.n➌: +4 strength
flavourText: Sometimes I'd rather have bare bones working for me than an army of muscle.-Max Forward

name: Skullcap
text: T: Prevent any amount of Net or brain damage.
flavourText: Just the superficial sort of an icon that someone grounded too far in 'reality' would think up. TURN UP THE FEED, YOU WIGGLY MEAT THINGS! THIS IS THE NET! NOTHING'S REAL! YOU HAVE NO HEAD!-Rache Bartmoss

name: Taxman
text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Tax counter. Every two Tax counters cause the Corp to lose ➊ at the start of each of its turns.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.
flavourText: The virus just alters their data. The actual damage is done by government auditors.-Spider Murphy

name: Vienna 22
text: After each successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Vienna counter. Each Vienna counter allows you to access an additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

name: Viral Pipeline
text: After each successful run on Archives, HQ, or R&D, put a Socket counter in that data fort. Socket counter from Archives, Socket counter from HQ, and Socket counter from R&D: Give the Corp a Pipe counter. Each Pipe counter causes the Corp to forgo an action at the start of each of its turns.nThe Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

name: Wrecking Ball
text: [0]: Break wall subroutine.n➋: +1 strengthnWhenever you break a wall subroutine with Wrecking Ball, lose ➊ from a stealth card.
flavourText: Form of a Dwarf!' 'Shape of a Pile Driver!' I'm sich of this Proteus crap. Gimme a good old-fashioned hammer programm any day.

name: Cortical Cybermodem
text: Provides +2 MU and +2 hand size. Put ➋ from the bank on Cortical Cybermodem when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them from the bank at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: Cortical Stimulators
text: Prevents 1 Net or brain damage each turn.
flavourText: Damn but those Zombies make your head itch!

name: Eurocprpseu2122 Spin Chip
text: Put ➋ from the bank on Spin Chip when it is installed. Spin Chip can have an icebreaker installed in it whose MU cost is no greater than 1. Use the bits on Spin Chip only to pay for using this icebreaker during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them from the bank at the start of your next turn.

name: Lucidrineu2122 Drip Feed
text: At the start of each of your turns, if there are two Drip counters on Drip Feed, remove all Drip counters from it and take 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented;otherwise, put a Drip counter on Drip Feed and gain an action.
flavourText: By the time he jacked out, his girlfriend had left him, and the dog was dead.

name: Sunburst Cranial Interface
text: Provides +1 MU and +1 hand size. Put ➊ from the bank on Cranial Interface when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use the bit, replace it from the bank at the start of your next turn.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

name: The Deck
text: [0]: Base link 5n➊: +1 linknProvides +1 MU.nUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.nOnly one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
flavourText: ...oh, an I'll also need a '20 Moebius Link.nA what?nYou know, Forward's deck. The Deck.nnGotcha.

name: Airport Locker
text: ➎, [T]: Search your stack for a program, and install that program, if you can. Shuffle your stack afterwards. You may use this ability during an encounter with a piece of ice.nHidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.

name: Back Door to Netwatch
text: ➌, [T]: Cancel the effect of a successful trace. Give the Corp 1 Bad Publicity point if the trace would have had an effect other than or in addition to giving you any tags.nHidden resources are installed face down, but are put into the trash face up.nIf the Corp has 7 or more Bad Publicity points, it loses the game, even if it fulfills victory conditions at the same time.

name: Back Door to Rivals
text: [0]: Base link 2 ➌: +1 linknGain ➊ whenever you successfully use Back Door to Rivals to avoid a trace.nUse only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
